properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.location: Billabong, Black Snake Creek, Budgee Budgee, Castleburn, Crooked River, Gibbs, Grant, Hawkhurst, Hogtown, Howittville, Maguires, Miowera, Moroka, Naarun, Peter the Swede, Selwyn, Shepherdson, Talbotville, Treasure, Waterford, Winchester, Wongungarra, Wonnangatta, Abbeyard, Arbuckle, Cowa, Howitt Plains, Wrathung
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Abbeyard, Arbuckle, Billabong, Black Snake Creek, Budgee Budgee, Castleburn, Cowa, Crooked River, Gibbs, Grant, Hawkhurst, Hogtown, Howitt Plains, Howittville, Maguires, Miowera, Moroka, Naarun, Peter the Swede, Selwyn, Shepherdson, Talbotville, Treasure, Waterford, Winchester, Wongungarra, Wonnangatta, Wrathung.
  • There are bushfires in the Wonnangatta Valley (known as the Wonnangatta - Dargo Complex) that are not yet under control.
  • Fire activity remains.  Monitor conditions and be ready to act. 
  • Emergency Services, Machinery and Aircraft are operating in the area and are working on suppressing the fire edges and building control lines. 
  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 1pm Firday 16 January.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
 What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Have a bushfire plan. Visit the CFA website for details on how to prepare your and your property for a bushfire.   Visit https://www.cfa.vic.gov.au
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
 Impacts in your area:

The following roads are restricted to residents and property owners only. Access will be permitted for essential maintenance and animal care. Proof of ownership is required and must be provided via Driver’s Licence or Rates Notice. 
  • Bairnsdale-Dargo Road at the Beverleys Road Junction 
  • Freestone Creek Road at Coopers Road   

The following roads are closed: 
  • Dargo High Plain Road between Dargo and Great Alpine Road 
  • Marathon Road at the Moroka Road Junction 
  • Marathon Road at the Boundary 24 Track Junction   
  • Wallers Road (between Friday Creek Road and Bairnsdale-Dargo Road)
  • Abbeyard Road (south of Rose River Road) 

The following Parks/Areas are closed to the public:  
  • Blue Pool on Freestone Creek Road is Closed   
  • The Alpine National Park north of Briagolong, East of Arbuckle Junction and Mount Howitt, west of Dargo including the Wonnangatta, and south of Abbeyard, west of the Great Alpine Rd to Lake Cobbler is Closed.  
  • The Mitchell River National Park is Closed 
  • Buckland Valley, Buffalo Valley Roads and surrounds are closed. 
Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

For additional Park Closure updates refer to 
  • Parks Victoria - https://www.parks.vic.gov.au/
  • Forest Fire Management - https://www.ffm.vic.gov.au/
Emergency Services are operating in the area.  
Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 18/01/2026 01:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
  • https://www.parks.vic.gov.au/places-to-see/parks/alpine-national-park#change-of-conditions
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: East Natimuk, Grass Flat, Natimuk, Quantong, Vectis, Vectis East, Vectis South, Lower Norton
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for East Natimuk, Grass Flat, Lower Norton, Natimuk, Quantong, Vectis, Vectis East, Vectis South.
  • The grass fire in the Natimuk, Quantong and Vectis area is now under control. 
  • Firefighting vehicles and other agencies will remain the area as part of the response and recovery efforts. 
  • Small flare-ups are normal in the aftermath of a major fire and may trigger an alert on Vic Emergency app. If these are within the burnt area they are unlikely to cause major issues but will be dealt with by crews on the fireground. 
  • For recovery information visit the HRCC Grass Flat Fire Recovery web page. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Watch & Act issued Thursday 15 January 2026 at 4:56pm. 
The threat to the community has reduced, however firefighters continue to patrol the area and attend to small flare ups. Smoke and flames may continue to be visible from this fire for a number of days. Residents should stay alert for dangerous trees and electrical hazards. 
What you should do: 
  • Avoid visiting the area unless you have a legitimate reason for being there. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Some local roads remain closed due to safety concerns. Continue to obey all road signage. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 20/01/2026 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Allenvale, Kennett River, Lorne, Separation Creek, Wye River
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for the Great Ocean Road from Kennett River to Lorne. 
  • The immediate threat of flash flooding has passed.
  • Dangerous hazards including mud, debris, damaged roads and fallen trees are still present. 
  • Crews are monitoring roads and bridges. Drive to the conditions. Follow directions from emergency services and traffic management.
There is no immediate threat to the community but hazards may still be present in the warning area. 
Impacts in your area.
  • The Great Ocean Road has reopened between Lorne and Skenes Creek. Cumberland Bridge has been partially opened with traffic management in place. Slow down and drive with caution. The Department of Transport and Planning is regularly inspecting the bridge.
  • Wye River Pedestrian Bridge remains closed.
  • Cumberland River Holiday Park remains closed. Park management will contact guests directly.
  • Parts of the Great Otway National Park remain closed. Parks Victoria are inspecting and repairing damaged areas. Visit https://www.parks.vic.gov.au for the latest information on park closures.
Other Information
Relief centres are closed. 
Information points will be open at the following locations between 9am - 5pm. The phone numbers are available 24 hours a day.
  • Great Ocean Road Visitor Information Centre - 100 Great Ocean Rd, Apollo Bay - 03 5232 9400
  • Lorne Visitor Information Centre - 15 Mountjoy Parade, Lorne - 1300 891 152 (between 9am and 5pm) or 03 5261 0600 (after hours).
This message was issued by the State Emergency Service. 

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this incident. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • www.epa.vic.gov.au for water quality information
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Carlisle River between Lavers-Hill Cobden Road and Carlisle Road
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Carlisle River between Lavers-Hill Cobden Road and Carlisle Road. 
  • There is a bushfire at Carlisle River (Kennedys Creek) that is under control.
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft have been working on the fireground for a number of days to bring the fire under control.
  • Smoke may still be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • This Community Information message replaces the Community Information issued on 16/01/2026 at 7:38 pm.
There is no immediate threat to the community, however further hazardous tree assessment needs to occur over the coming days to ensure that the area is safe. Smoke and flames may continue to be visible from this fire for a number of days.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Road closures will remain in place until hazardous tree assessments can be completed and roads assessed. Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

  • Anyone seeing native wildlife that appear caught, injured or distressed as a result of the fire should call the Incident Control Centre during daylight hours on 1300 322 056, who will coordinate assistance, or via the DEECA Wildlife Emergency App.

The Colac Performing Arts and Cultural Centre (COPACC) has been setup as an information point, open during business hours.

For information on returning home after an emergency, including information on private drinking water and tank safety after a fire, please visit the relief and recovery tab on the VicEmergency web page or app.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.location: Irrewillipe between White Peg Road and Irrewillipe Road to the west of Colac - Lavers Hill Road
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Irrewillipe between White Peg Road and Irrewillipe Road to the west of Colac - Lavers Hill Road.
  • There is a bushfire at Carlisle River that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters have been able to slow the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • Firefighters are working to consolidate a fire edge on the south-east corner of the fire, by undertaking a burning out operation.
  • Firefighters will be actively working in the area for some time. 
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued on 16/01/2025 at 4:55 pm.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
Smoke and visible flames may be seen from nearby roads and communities as crews undertake the burning out operation. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Anyone seeing native wildlife that appear caught, injured or distressed as a result of the fire should call the Incident Control Centre during daylight hours on 1300 322 056, who will coordinate assistance or via the DEECA Wildlife Emergency App.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 18/01/2026 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
For information on returning home after an emergency, including information on private drinking water and tank safety after a fire, please visit the relief and recovery tab on the VicEmergency webpage or app.

The Colac Performing Arts and Cultural Centre (COPACC) has been setup as an information point, open during business hours.

Accessibility:

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Tallangatta Valley, Granya, Bungil, Burrowye, Mount Alfred and Guys Forest
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Tallangatta Valley, Granya, Bungil, Burrowye, Mount Alfred and Guys Forest. 
  • The bushfire that started 27Km West Of Walwa is not yet under control. 
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. 
  • You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • Crews are working to strengthen containment lines and conduct controlled back burning. 
  • Aircraft and heavy machinery are continuing to work on the fire. 
  • This may cause an increase in smoke in the area.

Access the latest Community Newsletter online.
The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Tallangatta Creek Road from the Murray Valley Highway to Rousseaus Road has opened for local traffic only. 
  • Residents that live south of Rousseaus Road are still unable to return. 
  • The Murray River Road has opened for local traffic only. 
  • Shelley Road between Guys Forest Road and Murray Valley Highway remains closed. 
  • The Murray Valley Highway has opened for Emergency Services only.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • For localised mental health support please contact Albury Wodonga Health Mental Health Triage Line on 1300 104 211

Community Meetings: 
Monday 19th January 2026:
  • Mitta Mitta - 11:00am at Magorra Park Multipurpose Centre
  • Tallangatta Valley - 2:00pm at Tallangatta Valley Town Hall 
Tuesday 20th January 2026:
  • Walwa - 11:00am at Walwa Recreation Reserve 
  • Corryong - 2:00pm at Corryong Memorial Hall 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 19/01/2026 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Barkers Creek, Dog Rocks Saddle, Faraday, Harcourt, Harcourt North, Ravenswood South, Sutton Grange, Walmer.
  • The fire that started from Fogartys Gap Road, Ravenswood South has been contained.
  • Fire damaged trees remain a serious hazard in the burnt area and crews are still undertaking assessments. Trees or limbs may fall without warning.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 10:40am and the Watch & Act message issued at 10:41am on Saturday, 17 January 2026. 
The area remains unsafe. Residents who need to return are able to but be aware of hazards including trees, machinery and firefighting vehicles. 

Access to Mount Alexander Regional Park is strictly prohibited. This is for your safety and the safety of our crews. 
The threat has reduced, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions. 
What you should do: 
  • Be aware that firefighting vehicles and other agencies will remain the area as part of the response and recovery efforts. Please keep roads and properties clear.
Other Information:
  • A Recovery Hub is open at the Castlemaine Town Hall, 25 Lyttleton Street, open daily from 11:00am to 5:00pm.
  • For affected residents, the Recovery Hub includes a number of agencies and organisations that can assist you through the recovery process including temporary accommodation support.
  • The recording of the latest community meeting can be accessed from the Mount Alexander Shire Council Facebook page. 
  • The Community Newsletter shared on the 16 January 2026 is available here with key information on current activity in the Harcourt area.
  • Community Newsletters are available at key locations.
  • Refer to Mount Alexander Shire Council website for further information on relief, recovery and accessibility. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • The Mount Alexander Regional Park is closed.
  • The Water Quality warning issued for Harcourt has been downgraded and tap water is now safe to use. 

The following roads are closed: 
  • Harmony Way from Gaaschs Road to Twyford Street 
  • Harmony Way north of Blackjack Road  
  • Eagles Road from McIvor Road to Market Street  
  • Victoria Road from Calder In-Ramp to Coolstore Road, Harcourt 
  • Joseph Young Drive 
  • McIvor Road, Harcourt/Harcourt North
  • Richards Road/Byrnes Road - South of Harcourt-Sutton Grange Road
We are working on making roads safe before they open.

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 18/01/2026 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Acheron, Alexandra, Ancona, Cathkin, Caveat, Creightons Creek, Devils River, Dropmore, Fawcett, Ghin Ghin, Gobur, Gooram, Highlands, Kanumbra, Kelvin View, Killingworth, Koriella, Limestone, Longwood, Longwood East, Maintongoon, Merton, Molesworth, Old Longwood, Ruffy, Tarcombe, Terip Terip, Thornton, Upton Hill, Whanregarwen, Woodfield, Yarck, Yea.
  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 9.47am on Friday 16th January.
  • There is a bushfire that started at Longwood that is not yet under control. Many roads in this area have been impacted by fire, and damaged trees are continually falling across these roads. Roads are being prioritised and assessed for safe access.
  • Fire crews and aircraft continue to work in and patrol these areas.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

Traffic Management Points are currently in place across the impacted and surrounding areas due to the high level of danger to the community posed by falling trees.

We're asking those who are not local to the area to avoid unnecessary travel to respect that only people who need to get through will be given access. Traffic management points are in place to ensure your safety and you may be asked for ID.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Road closure and opening information - The Goulburn Valley Highway from Yea, to Cathkin is now open. This includes the road network from Cathkin to Alexandra - Goulburn Valley Highway merging to the Maroondah Highway.
  • These roads have been opened as an access level C - Authorised Access for residents and essential services.
  • This allows access to - Local residents returning to their homes, People providing recovery and relief and essential services to residents in this area, Council or VicRoads employees or subcontractors, Business owners in the immediate area of Ruffy, DEECA or Ag Vic staff facilitating the treatment and humane destruction of injured animals, Individuals or groups delivering relief and aid to residents and animals.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.

properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Koetong, Shelley, Berringama, Lucyvale, Nariel Valley, Burrowye and surrounds. 
  •  It is Not Safe to Return to the warning area. 
  • There is a bushfire at 25km west of Walwa that is not yet under control. 
  • Crews are working to strengthen containment lines and conduct controlled back burning in the southern section of the fire. This may cause an increase in smoke in the area. 
  • Aircraft and heavy machinery are continuing to work on the fire. 
  • This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 6:56am. 

Access the latest Community Newsletter online.
If you left the area, it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.   
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

Impacts in your area:
  • The Murray River Road has opened for local traffic only. 
  • Shelley Road between Guys Forest Road and Murray Valley Highway remains closed.

properties.text: WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Not Safe to Return Incident Location: 25Km west of Walwa Issue Date: Saturday 17 January 2026, 06:35 pm Next Update: Monday 19 January 2026, 12:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/40317/moreinfo This Watch and Act message is being issued for Koetong, Shelley, Berringama, Lucyvale, Nariel Valley, Burrowye and surrounds. - It is Not Safe to Return to the warning area. - There is a bushfire at 25km west of Walwa that is not yet under control. - Crews are working to strengthen containment lines and conduct controlled back burning in the southern section of the fire. This may cause an increase in smoke in the area. - Aircraft and heavy machinery are continuing to work on the fire. - This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 6:56am. Access the latest Community Newsletter online. If you left the area, it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards. What you should do: If you have not already left: - Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards. - Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance. If you have already left: - Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. - Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

properties.location: Colac Colac, Nariel Valley, Cudgewa, Corryong, Towong, Tintaldra, Pine Mountain, Thowgla Valley, Biggara, Walwa and surrounds
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Colac Colac, Nariel Valley, Cudgewa, Corryong, Towong, Tintaldra, Pine Mountain, Thowgla Valley, Biggara, Walwa and surrounds.
  • There is a bushfire 25Km west of Walwa that is not yet under control.
  • Crews are working to strengthen containment lines and conduct controlled back burning. This may cause an increase in smoke in the area.
  • Aircraft and heavy machinery are continuing to work on the fire. 
  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued on at 6:56am

Access the latest Community Newsletter online.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • If you are currently driving slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • The Murray River Road has opened for local traffic only. 
  • Shelley Road between Guys Forest Road and Murray Valley Highway remains closed. 
  • The Murray Valley Highway has opened for Emergency Services only. 
  • Keep up to date with road closures by monitoring the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70.
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
  • Parts of the Rail Trail bike path are closed, follow signage in the area.
  • For localised mental health support please contact Albury Wodonga Health Mental Health Triage Line on 1300 104 211

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Cobden, Simpson and Pirron Yallock communities, and communities south-west of Colac
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the Cobden, Simpson and Pirron Yallock communities, and communities south-west of Colac. 
  • There is a bushfire at Carlisle River that is not yet under control. 
  • Smoke and active fire will be visible from nearby communities and roads, due to a burning out operation being undertaken on Saturday, 17th of January 2026.
  • Firefighters are working to consolidate a fire edge on the south-east corner of the fire. 
  • The burning out operation is being carefully managed, and aims to strengthen containment lines and improve overall safety in the area.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
Smoke and visible flames may be seen from nearby roads and communities as crews carry out planned burning out operations. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:

  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
